extension.name: System - Zen Shortcodes
extension.author: Joomla Bamboo
extension.description: Zen Shortcodes is a plugin built for Zen Grid Framework v4 compatible themes. Use it to render icons, layouts within content and buttons compatible with your template.

field.label: Font Awesome Settings
field.desc: The following settings determine how the Font Awesome font library is implemented in the shortcode plugin. Disabling the font awesome icons below will remove the font awesome icons from the array of tags available for use with the plugin. You may want to do this if you want to add only a small number of icons to the shortcode array or if you only wish to use custom icons as specified below. Disabling this option may improve performance for rendering shortcode syntax on the page. Please also note that if your template already loads the font awesome library you can disable the loading of the Font Awesome css.

field.description: This setting determines the icons to be used in the shortcode syntax.
field.label: Enable Font Awesome icons
field.name: icon_select

field.description: Enable this if your template does not already load the Font Awesome Library. If you are using a Zen Grid Framework v4 theme leave this setting off.
field.label: Load Font Awesome css
field.name: fa_css

field.label: Custom Icon Settings
field.desc: Enter a comma separated list of any custom icons you wish to display using the shortcodes syntax. The names entered below will be available using the following syntax {zen-yourcustomname}content{/zen-yourcustomname}. Items added here will be rendered within span classes using the following classes zen-icon zen-iconyourcustomname.

field.label: Custom Prefix
field.desc: The custom prefix option determines how the tags are rendered in your markup. For example if you want to add additional Font Awesome fonts enter 'fa fa-' here or to use ZGFv4 name spaced fonts enter zen-icon zen-icon-.

field.label: Custom Syntax Settings
field.desc: Enter a comma separated list of any custom syntax you wish to display using the shortcodes syntax. The items will be rendered according to the name entered here. eg {zen-customname}Your content{/zen-customname}. The resulting content will be output in a span class using the customname entered.
